parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To shout, call aloud, proclaim. Apparently a prolonged form of a primary verb; to halloo, i.e. Shout.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
David, King of Israel. Of Hebrew origin; Dabid, the Israelite king.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To pity, have mercy on. From eleos; to compassionate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
